intro: [WRONG START] Homoia javensis var. ciliata, commonly known as the Java homonoia, is a species of flowering plant in the family Araliaceae. It is native to Southeast Asia, particularly Indonesia, and is characterized by its compound leaves with serrated margins. The plant produces small, white to greenish flowers arranged in umbels, which are typically followed by orange-red berries. It thrives in humid, tropical climates and is often found in lowland forests. Due to its ornamental value, it is cultivated in botanical gardens and as a houseplant in some regions.
